content.question: A mass is supported by two strings attached to the ceiling which have tensions <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> at angles <math alttext="theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> below the horizontal as shown in the figure. If <math alttext="theta sub 1 is greater than theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, what is the relationship between these tensions and which of the following statement justifies this relationship?

choices.label: <math alttext="T sub 1 is greater than T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. The magnitude of the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-components of the strings must equal each other and the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-component of <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is greater than that of <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> because <math alttext="theta sub 1 is greater than theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.

<math alttext="T sub 1 is greater than T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. The magnitude of the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-components of the strings must each equal half the weight of the hanging mass and the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-component of <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is greater than that of <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> because <math alttext="theta sub 1 is greater than theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.

<math alttext="T sub 1 is less than T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. The length of the first string is less than the length of the second string, so it has less tension.

<math alttext="T sub 1 is less than T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. The <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-components of the strings must each equal half the weight of the hanging mass and the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is greater than that of <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> because <math alttext="theta sub 1 is greater than theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="T sub 1 is greater than T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. The magnitude of the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-components of the strings must equal each other and the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-component of <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is greater than that of <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> because <math alttext="theta sub 1 is greater than theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
